means: 想像
设想
想要
猜想
设想
想像力
爱好
怪想
（构思者）奇特的
昂贵的
（价格等）高价的
[美国俚语]真棒
想象，幻想

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"想象，幻想"之意。
means: imagination ： 含义广，一般不含贬义。可指认真、带有启发性的想象，也可指凭记忆的想象或凭空想象事物的能力。
fancy ： 指脱离实际的幻想或幻想力，常暗含所想象的东西近乎怪诞的意味。
fantasy ： 指与现实完全脱节，荒诞离谱、稀奇古怪的想象。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"喜欢，喜爱"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: like, love, enjoy, fancy, adore, prefer
means: like ： 最常用词，往往只表不太强烈的兴趣或关注，不带强烈的感情，除非另加修饰语。
love ： 不但表示强烈的喜欢，而且含依恋之情，因此多用于能激起深厚情感的人或物。
enjoy ： 指对能提供感观或智力上满足或快乐的东西表示欣赏或喜爱。
fancy ： 指喜爱投合自己心意、嗜好或欲望等的人或物。
adore ： 非正式用词，口语体。指非常喜爱，带强烈的感情色彩。
prefer ： 指有选择性或偏向性的喜欢。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"在思想中形成一个看法或观念"之意。
means: think ： 最普通用词，指想或思索，也指由反复思考而作出判断或得出结论等。
conceive ： 指在头脑中组织好自己的思想，在心中形成一个系统的思想或一个见解。
imagine比conceive更强调形象思维，指在头脑中形成一个清晰明确的意象。
fancy与imagine略不同，往往指的是不切实际的，属于梦幻般的想象。
realize ： 指领悟，通过生动的构思或想象从而抓住事物的本质。

sentence.Network_en: It was packaged in a fancy plastic case with attractive graphics.
sentence.Network_cn: 它装在一个别致的有漂亮图纹的塑料盒子里。

sentence.Network_en: She did not suspect that his interest was just a passing fancy.
sentence.Network_cn: 她相信这不过是他一时兴起。

sentence.Network_en: He owned a fancy house out on Lake Agawam.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在阿格瓦姆湖畔拥有一座豪宅。

phrase.cizu_name: as (或 when 或 where) the fancy takes one

jx.jx_cn_mean: 由兴趣主宰；由着性子；跟着感觉

lj.lj_ly: you could move about as the fancy took you.

jx.jx_en_mean: believe that one (or someone else) is likely to be successful
jx.jx_cn_mean: 相信自己（或别人）会成功

lj.lj_ly: we fancy our chances in the replay.
lj.lj_ls: 我们相信自己会在复赛中取胜。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 讨某人喜欢；迎合某人的口味；吸引某人

jx.jx_en_mean: to become fond of, especially without an obvious reason

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: contraction of fantasy

encyclopedia.content: fancy含义 1、fancy代表：想象力，爱好，迷恋等。 2、fancy亦=fan+Cy，具有特殊的含义，从前有一个男孩子叫fan，一个女孩子叫Cy。男孩子默默的喜欢这这个女孩子，自己的英文名字也定了 fanCy.多年后，依然。 3、希望人生能像fancy这个词一样精彩！

entry.def: If you fancy something, you want to have it or to do it.

example.ex: What do you fancy doing, anyway?...
example.tran: 你到底想干什么？

example.ex: Do you fancy going to see a movie sometime?...
example.tran: 你想不想有空去看场电影？

entry.def: A fancy is a liking or desire for someone or something, especially one that does not last long.

example.ex: She did not suspect that his interest was just a passing fancy.
example.tran: 她相信这不过是他一时兴起。

entry.def: If you fancy someone, you feel attracted to them, especially in a sexual way.

example.ex: The boys would tease you to death if they didn't fancy you...
example.tran: 如果男孩们不喜欢你的话，他们就会狠狠地捉弄你。

example.ex: I think he thinks I fancy him or something.
example.tran: 我想他以为我爱慕他或什么的。

entry.tran: 想让自己成为;想让自己做
entry.def: If you fancy yourself as a particular kind of person or fancy yourself doing a particular thing, you like the idea of being that kind of person or doing that thing.

example.ex: So you fancy yourself as the boss someday?...
example.tran: 这么说，你是想有一天自己当上老板喽？

example.ex: I didn't fancy myself wearing a kilt.
example.tran: 我不想穿褶裥短裙。

entry.tran: 以为(自己)是;把(自己)当成
entry.def: If you say that someone fancies themselves (as) a particular kind of person, you mean that they think, often wrongly, that they have the good qualities which that kind of person has.

example.ex: She fancies herself a bohemian...
example.tran: 她自以为是放荡不羁的艺术家。

example.ex: She knew Felix fancied himself as a connoisseur.
example.tran: 她知道费利克斯把他自己当成鉴赏家。

entry.tran: 相信(参赛的某队或某人)会赢
entry.def: If you say that you fancy a particular competitor or team in a competition, you think they will win.

example.ex: You have to fancy Bath because they are the most consistent team in England...
example.tran: 巴斯队一定会赢，因为他们是英格兰表现最稳定的球队。

example.ex: I fancy England to win through.
example.tran: 我认为英格兰队会一路胜出。

entry.def: If you fancy that something is the case, you think or suppose that it is so.

example.ex: When Ferris looked up he fancied that he saw a shadow pass close to the window...
example.tran: 费里斯抬头向上看，感觉看见一个影子在窗子近旁经过。

example.ex: She fancied he was trying to hide a smile.
example.tran: 她猜想他正在尽力掩饰笑容。

entry.def: A fancy is an idea that is unlikely, untrue, or imaginary.

example.ex: His last book is a bold, at times surrealistic mixture of fact and fancy.
example.tran: 他的最后一部书把现实与梦幻大胆糅合在一起，有些地方表现出超现实主义色彩。

example.ex: ...a childhood fancy.
example.tran: 儿时的幻想

entry.tran: (表达惊奇或不赞成)真想不到，太意外
entry.def: You say 'fancy' or 'fancy that' when you want to express surprise or disapproval.

example.ex: It was very tasteless. Fancy talking like that so soon after his death...
example.tran: 这真是太不得体了。真想不到在他尸骨未寒时就那么说话。

example.ex: 'Fancy that!' smiled Conti.
example.tran: “真想不到！”康蒂笑着说。

entry.tran: (通常指不知何故就)爱上，喜欢上
entry.def: If you take a fancy to someone or something, you start liking them, usually for no understandable reason.

example.ex: Sylvia took quite a fancy to him...
example.tran: 西尔维娅深深爱上了他。

example.ex: The King took a fancy to ordering disguises and masks.
example.tran: 国王迷上了订购化装用品和面具。

entry.def: If something takes your fancy or tickles your fancy, you like it a lot when you see it or think of it.

example.ex: She makes most of her own clothes, copying any fashion which takes her fancy.
example.tran: 她的衣服多是仿照她喜爱的时装自己缝制的。

entry.def: If you describe something as fancy, you mean that it is special, unusual, or elaborate, for example because it has a lot of decoration.

example.ex: It was packaged in a fancy plastic case with attractive graphics.
example.tran: 它装在一个别致的有漂亮图纹的塑料盒子里。

example.ex: ...fancy jewellery.
example.tran: 精美的珠宝

entry.def: If you describe something as fancy, you mean that it is very expensive or of very high quality, and you often dislike it because of this.

example.ex: He owned a fancy house out on Lake Agawam...
example.tran: 他在阿格瓦姆湖畔拥有一座豪宅。

example.ex: They sent me to a fancy private school.
example.tran: 他们把我送到一所昂贵的私立学校学习。

means.word_mean: 1. something many people believe that is false;

sentences.sentence: "they have the illusion that I am very wealthy"

means.word_mean: 2. fancy was held by Coleridge to be more casual and superficial than imagination
1. imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind;

sentences.sentence: "I can see a risk in this strategy"

means.word_mean: 2. have a fancy or particular liking or desire for;

sentences.sentence: "She fancied a necklace that she had seen in the jeweler's window"

auth_sentence.content: They do live in a fancy world of theory.
auth_sentence.res_content: They do live in a fancy world of theory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They do live in a fancy world of theory.

auth_sentence.content: Brecel will now fancy his chances of progressing further.
auth_sentence.res_content: Brecel will now fancy his chances of progressing further.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Brecel will now fancy his chances of progressing further.

auth_sentence.content: I didn't come from some fancy congressional internship.
auth_sentence.res_content: I didn't come from some fancy congressional internship.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I didn't come from some fancy congressional internship.

Sentence.sentence: Although many other big firms resisted the temptation to over-borrow, developers borrowed heavily and built bigger and fancier hotels as if the whole world were planning a holiday in Las Vegas.

sentences.en: Can you fancy yourself on the moon?
sentences.cn: 你能想像自己登上月球是怎样一种情景吗?

sentences.en: I don't fancy this place at all.
sentences.cn: 我一点也不喜欢这个地方。

sentences.en: I don't fancy swimming in that river.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢在那条河里游泳。

sentences.en: “He had no clothes on.”“I fancy so.

means.word_mean: 设想, 空想, 幻想

sentences.cn: 儿童往往有丰富的想像力。

sentences.en: I have a fancy for some wine with my dinner.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢在晚餐时喝点酒。

means.word_mean: 别致的, 花式的, 花哨的

sentences.en: The dress is too fancy for me.
sentences.cn: 这件服装我穿太花哨了。

sentences.en: Let me fancy while I may.
sentences.cn: 让我在能幻想的时候尽情幻想吧。

jushi.english: You can tell that she fancies herself from the way she dresses.
jushi.chinese: 从她的衣着打扮你就可以看出她自以为很美。

jushi.english: I don't fancy this place at all.
jushi.chinese: 我一点也不喜欢这个地方。

jushi.english: My husband rather fancies an evening at home in front of the TV set.
jushi.chinese: 晚上我丈夫十分喜欢呆在家里在电视机前度过。
